intro: Palicourea boyacana, commonly known as the Colombian coffeeberry, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. Palicourea boyacana is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
